Cosine normalization of a matrix

Source: R/normalization.R
cosnormX.Rd

Normalizes a numeric matrix dividing each row (if rows=TRUE) or column (if rows=FALSE) by their L2 norm. Thus, each row (or column) has unit norm.

Usage

cosnormX(X, rows = TRUE)

Arguments

X

Numeric matrix or data.frame of any size.

rows

If TRUE, the operation is done by row; otherwise, it is done by column. (Defaults: TRUE).

Value

Cosine-normalized X.

Examples

dat <- matrix(rnorm(50),ncol=5,nrow=10)
cosnormX(dat)
#>                [,1]        [,2]        [,3]         [,4]        [,5]
#>  [1,] -1.862894e-01 -0.30809428 -0.58164128  0.707277006  0.17840076
#>  [2,]  1.761182e-01  0.77365469 -0.47950849  0.374104606 -0.02362507
#>  [3,] -1.317544e-02  0.92501733 -0.32979123 -0.179326581  0.05700053
#>  [4,] -3.813744e-01 -0.06494686 -0.15870194  0.895916293  0.14994379
#>  [5,]  4.133313e-03 -0.32203422 -0.82245328 -0.434568702 -0.17606113
#>  [6,]  2.420227e-01 -0.16326397  0.46996629  0.369146113  0.74674812
#>  [7,] -1.242098e-02  0.53559500 -0.62098790  0.009702709 -0.57206958
#>  [8,] -8.802303e-01 -0.33924432  0.02350475 -0.241192483 -0.22667519
#>  [9,]  7.880297e-05  0.36295155  0.72182910  0.587940556  0.03943124
#> [10,]  2.076936e-01 -0.19759876 -0.35527559 -0.788907563  0.41136627
